lines.text: Now it isn't that I don't like you, Susan, because, after all, in moments of quiet, I'm strangely drawn toward you, but - well, there haven't been any quiet moments.
this is *my* car!
You mean *this* is your car? *Your* golf ball? *Your* car? Is there anything in the world that doesn't belong to you?
Yes, thank heaven, YOU!
Well who are you?
I don't know. I'm not quite myself today.
Well, you look perfectly idiotic in those clothes.
These aren't *my* clothes.
Well, where *are* your clothes?
I've *lost* my clothes!
But why are you wearing *these* clothes?
Because I just went *GAY* all of a sudden!
Now see here young man, stop this nonsense. What are you doing?
I'm sitting in the middle of 42nd Street waiting for a bus.
[Susan is stealing David's car from the golf course]
Now, don't lose your temper.
My dear young lady, I'm not losing my temper. I'm merely trying to play some golf!
Well you choose the funniest places; this is a *parking-lot*.

[Susan is collecting pebbles]
Susan, what are you doing?
Pebbles.
Pebbles? What for?
Well, I've heard that if you throw pebbles up against a window, the people think it's hail and then they come and close the windows.
I, I, I - Oh!
[Susan throws the pebbles and they loudly crash against Peabody's window]
Oh, I know we ought to go now, but somehow I can't move.
[David discovers the leopard in Susan's bathroom]
Susan, you have to get out of this apartment!
I can't, I have a lease.
[David and Susan have just discovered that Baby is missing]
Now don't lose your head, Susan.
My what?
Don't lose your head!
I've got my head, I've lost my leopard!
[reading letter about new leopard]
"He's three years old, gentle as a kitten, and likes dogs." I wonder whether Mark means that he eats dogs or is fond of them?
You've just had a bad day, that's all.
That's a masterpiece of understatement.
But Susan, you can't climb in a man's bedroom window!
I know, it's on the second floor!
Alice I think this one must belong in the tail.
[referring to a bone he is holding]
Nonsense. You tried it in the tail yesterday, and it didn't fit.
The only way you'll ever get me to follow another of your suggestions is to hold a bright object in front of my eyes and twirl it.
You mean you want *me* to go home?
Yes.
You mean you don't want me to help you any more?
No.
After all the fun we've had?
Yes.
And after all the things I've done for you?
That's what I mean.
Well, don't you worry, David, because if there's anything that I can do to help you, just let me know and I'll do it.
Well, er - don't do it until I let you know.
How can all these things happen to just one person?
When a man is wrestling a leopard in the middle of a pond, he's in no position to run.
[last lines]
Oh, David, can you ever forgive me?
You can! And you still love me.
Susan, that... that...
You do. Oh, David.
Oh, dear. Oh, my.
I won't leave you, David! I love you!
What?
Now that's all perfectly clear, isn't it?
Yeah-No it *isn't* ! You see - she's going to give me an explanation...
No no no and my dear sir, it never *will* be clear, as long as she's explaining it!
There *is* a leopard on your roof and it's my leopard and I have to get it and to get it I have to sing.
[In jail]
Anyway, David, when they find out who we are they'll let us out.
When they find out who *you* are they'll pad the cell.
Oh David, what have you done?
Just name anything, and I've done it.
[Limping after losing a heel from one shoe]
I was born on the side of a hill.
[repeated line]
I'll be with you in a minute, Mr. Peabody!

[watching George the dog dig up what they think is David's dinosaur bone]
Oh, look, David, a boot.

[angrily]
A boot.
[picks it up and makes like he's going to swing with it]
Don't hit George, David.
I wasn't going to hit *George*!
[Susan is pretending to be a mobster]
Constable, she's making all this up out of motion pictures she's seen!
Oh, I suppose I saw you with that red-headed skirt in a motion picture ?
There you are doc - another woman.
Sure, I wouldn't be squealing if he hadn't give me the run-around with that other twist.
Oh, so he's a lady killer.
A lady killer? Why he's a regular Don Swan. Loves the ladies, don't ya, honey? He bops them over, one, two, three - boom - just like that.
[Pretends to open a cork and toss it away]
He's a wolf.

[Claps his head]
Oh, so now I'm a wolf!
[Collapses on a cot]
So if you don't mind, Susan, I'll see Mr. Peabody alone, and unarmed.
Without me?
Yes, without you, and *definitely* without you.

[Gogarty, David, and Susan are in jail]
Miss Susan! How'd you get here?
Influence.
Don't worry, Gogarty, I'll get you out.
Oh, sure. Look, she got me out.
Susan, is there any way to cross this stream?
Oh, surely it's shallow. We can wade across.
[they both walk into the stream, then fall in after the floor drops off]
Oh, Susan...
The riverbed's changed!
Who is this David?
He's a friend of Mark's.
Is that all you know about him?
No, I know that I'm gonna marry him. He doesn't know it but I am.

Now see here, if you're planning to marry him on my money you are very much mistaken. I don't want another lunatic in the family I have lunatics enough all ready. When are you going to marry him? What's his name?
It's uh Bone
Bones ?
One Bone
Well one bone or two bones it's a ridiculous name.
What does he do?
He hunts
Hunts? Hunts what?
Well - animals I should think.
Oh, I'm caught on something - David, help me, will you?
Oh, no. That's poison ivy.
I bet you wouldn't treat Miss Swallow this way.
I bet Miss Swallow knows poison ivy when she sees it.
Yes, I bet poison ivy runs when it sees her.

[on the phone]
Yes, I did see Mr. Peabody, but I didn't see him. Well that is, I didn't see him really. Yes, I spoke to him twice, but I didn't talk to him.
But David, I don't understand. Did you see him or didn't you ?
Well - no I don't know - well how do I know ? well because - because - well there's someone at the door - you see there are some things that are very hard to explain, Alice.
Now once and for all, David, *nothing* must interfere with your work. Our marriage must entail no domestic entanglements of any kind.

[Stammering nervously]
You mean... you mean...

[Firmly]
I mean of *any* kind, David.

[Pointing to a mark on the golf ball Susan just sank]
There you see, it's a circle.
Well, of course it is, do you think it would roll if it were square?

[David has just slipped on the olive Susan had dropped and he has fallen backward - sitting upon his hat]
Well I might have known you were here. I had a feeling - just as I hit the floor.
That was your hat.
What would you say about a man who follows a girl around...
Follows her around...
...And then when she talks to him, he fights with her?
Fights with her... is the young man your fiance?
Well, the love impulse in men very frequently reveals itself in terms of conflict.

[Excitedly]
The love impulse!
Without my knowing anything about it, my rough guess would be, that he has a fixation on you, a fixation...
No no wait a minute, I can't remember any more than that!

[to David]
You know why you're following me? You're a fixation.
You're angry, aren't you?
Yes, I am!
Mm-hmm. The love impulse in man frequently reveals itself in terms of conflict.
Now please listen to me - you certainly can't think that I did that intentionally!
Well, if I *could* think, I'd have run when I saw you!

[Susan realizes that she has torn the back of her dress]
Don't just stand there. Do something! Do something! Oh my goodness! Well, get behind me.
I *am* behind you.
Well, get closer.
I can't *get* any closer!

[Mrs. Random finds David and Susan running out of the house]
Susan Susan - come back here - come back here this minute! What are you doing?
Hunting for George.
Why?

[In a rush]
David wants him, David loves him, David thinks he's such a nice dog.
George is a fiend and you know it!
But David doesn't.
What are you doing?

[exasperated and wearing Susan's negligee]
I'm sitting in the middle of 42nd Street waiting for a bus!
You're just a butterfly.

[Susan is pretending to be a gun moll who is turning on supposed mobster partner David Bone by exposing his supposed alias to Constable Slocum]
You mean to say you don't remember 'Jerry the Nipper' ?
Constable she's making all this up out of motion pictures she's seen!
[Irene Dunne refers to Cary Grant as 'Jerry the Nipper' in 'The Awful Truth']
My bone. It's rare. It's precious. What did you do with it?
The bone!
Susan, you had it. Give it to me.
No, I haven't got it.
Did you carry it somewhere?
No, David. Why would I carry a bone around?
I wouldn't dare give a reason for anythting you do.
Well, I guess you'll have to find another one.
It took three expeditions and five years to find that one!
David, now that they know where to find one, couldn't you send them back to get another one?
First you drop an olive, and then I sit on my hat. It all fits perfectly.
Oh, yes, but you can't do that trick without dropping some of the olives; it takes practice.
What, to sit on my hat?
No, to drop an olive.
[first lines]
Good morning, Miss Swallow.
Shh.
Why what's the matter ?
Doctor Huxley is thinking.
Dr. Huxley, when I play golf, I only talk golf - and then only between shots.

[David is trying to prove to Susan that she's playing his ball]
You see, a PGA has two black dots and a Cro-Flight has a circle.
Mm-hmm. I'm not superstitious about things like that.
Well, what does he do?
He's a big game hunter.

[She sees David chasing George around]
You call that big game hunting?
I don't like leopards!
Well, just pretend he's a housecat.
I don't like cats, either.

[One the phone]
Have you got a leopard?
No.
Well, I've got a leopard, and you're a zoologist, so come over and help me.

[pauses]
Yes, David, of course I know what a zoologist is!

[after David answers the door to her dressed only in Susan's negligee]
Well, who is he?
Oh, he's a friend of Mark's, from brazil. He's had a nervous breakdown, and it's left him a little...
[Moves her hand in small circles next to her ear to indicate that David is insane]

[Under his breath]
Oh, so now I'm a nut from Brazil!
Why is he wearing your negligee?
Mark said that if he wants to wear a negligee, we have to let him wear a negligee.

[She brings David his intercostal clavicle]
Look! I found your bone!
How did you find it?
Well, I followed George around for three days. I dug holes with him, and he dug holes with me, and I found your bone!
What would happen if Baby and George got together?
They'd probably get along.
And if they didn't?
Then Baby would eat George.
You're just a butterfly.
Oh, so now I'm a butterfly!

[Reading aloud from letter]
"He likes music, especially that song 'I Can't Give You Anything But Love, Baby'."
[Puts down letter, switches on record player]
I wonder why he likes that song, it's such an old tune, and...

[Terrified]
Susan, if we put the Victrola in the bathroom, would he go back in there?
A million dollars! Say, that's pretty white of Mr. Peabody, isn't it?
